Contest responses to Lenore Skenazy's "Only in New York" and "New York Stories" columns, New York Daily News
Contest responses to Lenore Skenazy's "Only in New York" and "New York Stories" columns, New York Daily News
Tear sheets and photocopies of published "Only in New York" contests (scattered)
Tear sheets and photocopies of published "Only in New York" contests (scattered)

• ONY Contest 2. {How do you choose your lottery numbers?} [results published September 4, 1988] • ONY Contest 11. What was the most bizarre thing you ever witnessed on New York public transportation? [results published November 6, 1988] • ONY Contest 16. What's the one thing about holidays, apart from crowds, we mean, that makes you craziest? [results published December 11, 1988] • ONY Contest 23. How did your mom and dad meet? [results published February 5, 1989] • ONY Contest 25. A genuinely appropriate New York fortune cookie fortune. [results published February 19, 1989] • ONY Contest 31. What's your favorite New York cockroach story? [results published April 16, 1989] • ONY Contest 33. What was your worst experience with a rude New York salesperson? [results published April 30, 1989] • ONY Contest 40. The most incredibly annoying colleague you've ever dealt with. [results published June 18, 1989] • ONY Contest 46. What would you like to find when (and if) you get to heaven? [results published July 30, 1989] • ONY Contest 54. What was the most useless and irrelevant piece of advice your nice old grandparents ever gave you? [results published September 24, 1989] • ONY Contest 61. What was the most traumatic thing that happened to you in elementary school? [results published November 12, 1989] • ONY Contest 63. The stranger you never thanked. [results published November 26, 1989] • ONY Contest 71. What was the best time you ever had at Rockefeller Center? [results published January 28, 1990] • ONY Contest 73. How did your sweetie propose? [results published February 11, 1990] • ONY Contest 82. Your most obnoxious customer. [results published April 22, 1990]
